message.content:
{"id": "12906", 
"title": "Bug 12906 - Opening a file in another editor when it's already opened in one editor should give an error message", 
"description": "When a file is already opened in one editor, attempting to open it in another editor should result in an error message. Currently, nothing happens when trying to open the file with a system editor in the Java Perspective. The workbench should display a warning message informing the user that they may overwrite changes and asking if they want to continue, or an error message stating that all files must be closed first. We believe this behavior is a safety feature of the IDE to prevent external editing while a file is already opened." 
"OB": "1. Close the file.
2. Switch to the Java Perspective.
3. Double-click on a Java file to open it in the workbench.
4. Right-click on the Java file.
5. Select 'Open With' > 'System Editor'.",
"EB": "",
"SR": ""}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '12906', 'title': 'Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)', 'description': 'Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg) ', 'OB': "Close it.go to the Java Perspective, open a java file by simply double clickingon it.The file is now opened in the workbench.Now right click on the Java fileOpen With .. System Editor.Nothing happens.The workbench should be warning message saying thatyou may overwrite changes... and do you want to continue?or errormessage saying that theh should close all file first.We believe it's a safety feature where WSAD doesn't allow externalediting while the file is already opened in WSAD. ", 'EB': '', 'SR': ''}
